author: Amazon Customer

review: I have tried a number of things to make my T.V. Netflix compatible. Had a streaming box that was slow and lacked the full functions of each internet stream. Had a blueray player with wifi that never connected to the router. Finally, this little guy, and I do mean little. It plugs in behind the T.V. out of sight, freeing up space the other guys claimed. No more lost remotes - your phone is the remote. If you lose it you can simply call it to find. I can cast webpages, Youtube, Netflix, pretty much everything except amazon prime, which is a shame. It connects quickly. You can pause or rewind a show with your phone still locked. Plus, when it's on but not connected to anything, the screensaver images are breathtaking on the television screen. I cannot say enough good things about it.
author: Amazon Customer

review: So you have to control it via a tablet or pc or phone.  No problem there except it can get annoying if you watch in bed and have to keep grabbing the device you're charging to turn things off.  Could not get Plex to function in any reasonable fashion making it a paperweight at this point.  Plex just keeps pausing and playing and pausing despite playing great on Samsung TV in another room, or even using a Roku box in the same part of the house as the chromecast.  So yeah, it's cheap.  But unless you're just using it for Netflix or Hulu it doesn't do much more than that... but it does that well.

review: Pros:It's small, it fits right behind your TV, and you can use your phone to control it. Let also not forget about its most important feature: the price.Cons:Limited app support. It is an open source device so I can only imagine we will see a lot more software come out for this device, but at the same time its current state is very limited and buggy. I use mine with an iPhone which is even more cumbersome. I have had friends with android phones hook up to the chromecast, but it still had the same limitations, it was just less buggy.Overall:Very cool and innovative device, but not something I would buy for your mom and dad. It would be for a hobbyist or someone who likes testing new technology.
